metadata.title: CVE-2013-1434 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple SQL injection vulnerabilities in (1) api_poller.php and (2)utility.php in Cacti before 0.8.8b allow remote attackers to executearbitrary SQL commands via unspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1434` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cacti - 0.8.8b+dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cacti package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.8b+dfsg-5').
